resources.string: fit

\n
Lie on the bench with your eyes under the bar. \n
Grab the bar with a medium grip-width. \n
Unrack the bar by straightening your arms. \n
Lower the bar to your mid-chest. \n
Press the bar back up until your arms are straight.

\n
Choose weights that allow you to maintain proper form \n
Lie on an exercise mat to do floor flies. \n
Use a flat bench for more range of motion doing lying chest flies. \n
Do standing dumbbell flies. \n
Adjust your bench to a 45-degree angle to do inclined flies

\n
Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbell at a shoulder-width grip \n
curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. \n
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. \n
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in. \n
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

\n
Stand with your mid-foot under the bar (medium stance) \n
Bend over and grab the bar (palms down, medium-grip) \n
Unlock your knees while keeping your hips high \n
Lift your chest and straighten your back \n
Pull the bar against your lower chest

\n
Place the pulleys on a high position \n
Step forward in front of an imaginary straight line \n
Your torso should have a small forward bend from the waist. \n
Extend your arms to the side in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest \n
Return your arms back to the starting position as you breathe out.

\n
Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. \n
Place your hands behind your head so your thumbs are behind your ears. \n
Hold your elbows out to the sides but rounded slightly in. \n
Tilt your chin slightly, leaving a few inches of space between your chin and your chest. \n
Gently pull your abdominals inward.

\n
Stand with your mid-foot under the barbelL \n
Bend over and grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip \n
Bend your knees until your shins touch the bar \n
Lift your chest up and straighten your lower back \n
Take a big breath, hold it, and stand up with the weight

\n
Stand with your mid-foot under the barbelL \n
Bend over and grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip \n
Bend your knees until your shins touch the bar \n
Lift your chest up and straighten your lower back \n
Take a big breath, hold it, and stand up with the weight

\n
Get on a mat. \n
Move into push up position \n
Place your hands under your chest and make a diamond shape \n
Lower yourself to the ground, then push up.

\n
Grab the parallel bars and jump up, straighten your arms \n
Lower your body by bending your arms while leaning forward \n
Dip down until your shoulders are below your elbows \n
Lift your body up by straightening your arm \n
Lock your elbows at the top

\n
Step onto the machine facing the monitor \n
Begin pedaling to turn it on.. \n
Start pedaling at an even pace.. \n
Do not lock your knees. \n
Turn up the resistance

\n
Grab an EZ-Bar with an underhand grip, \n
sit on a preacher bench. \n
Place the back of your upper arms against the padding \n
Contract your biceps to curl the bar toward your shoulders

\n
Grab two dumbbells and stand up straight. \n
lift the dumbbells to the front. \n
Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position. \n
Repeat for the desired number of reps

\n
Pick up the dumbbells. \n
Bend your elbows slightly. \n
Lift the dumbbell \n
Lift the dumbbells with your palms out.

\n
Start with your hands in the "ready" position. \n
Practice a toe catch. \n
Pretend jump. \n
Practice timing. \n
Try the real thing.

\n
Stand to the right of your weight bench \n
Place your left lower leg and your left hand on top of the bench. \n
Lean forward at the hips until your upper body is at a 45-degree angle to the floor. \n
Bend your right elbow so your upper arm is parallel to the floor

\n
Sit at a lat pulldown station and grab the bar \n
Your arms should be completely straight and your torso upright. \n
ull your shoulder blades down and back \n
bring the bar to your chest \n
Pause, then slowly return to the starting position.

\n
push the platform away with your heels and forefoot. \n
Your heels should remain flat on the footplate \n
extend your legs and keep your head and back flat against the seat pad. \n
Pause at the top of the movement. \n
Do not lock out your knees and ensure that they are not bowing out or in.

\n
Start in a standing position. \n
Take a big step forward with your right leg. \n
Lower your body until your right knee is at a 90-degree angle. \n
Push yourself upwards with your right foot. \n
Repeat the forward lunge.

\n
Stand with the bar on your front shoulders. \n
your hands next to your shoulders \n
Press the bar over your head, until it’s balanced over your shoulders and mid-foot \n
lock your elbows at the top, and shrug your shoulders to the ceiling./

\n
Position your elbows directly beneath your shoulders. \n
Make and maintain a straight body line from head to heels. \n
Squeeze your butt and the fronts of your thighs. \n
Brace your abs like you’re going to take a punch. \n
Advance the exercise.

\n
set up a preacher curl bench according to your height \n
Rest your arms on the pad with your triceps at the top, \n
Elevate the bar towards your chest in a smooth arc, pause for a moment. \n
Then lower the bar by extending your arms back to the starting position. \n
Repeat until you’ve hit your targeted reps.

\n
Stand a dumbbell on a bench. \n
Lay perpendicular, resting your shoulders on the bench. \n
Plant your feet on the floor while holding your back straight. \n
Lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head

\n
Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell on each hand resting on top of your thighs. \n
eturn your arms back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles and breathe out. \n
Unrack the bar by straightening your arms. \n
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

\n
Stand with your legs about hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your left hand by your side. \n
Bend your torso forward at your waist so that your arms extend below your body. \n
Shift your weight toward your right foot as you lift. \n
Lower your arm to the starting position as you shift your weight back toward the center of your body.

\n
Kneel 1-2 feet in front of a cable system with a rope attached. \n
fter selecting an appropriate weight, grasp the rope with both hands reaching overhead. \n
flex at the spine, attempt to bring your rib cage to your legs as you pull the cable down. \n
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

\n
Pick your weights. \n
stand up straight with your shoulders back and the weights at your feet. \n
Keep your arms at your side and fully extended downward \n
Remember to lift with your knees. \n
Keep your back straight, your feet shoulder-width apart, and your buttocks tight.

\n
start by lying on your back with your knees bent. \n
Put your fingertips on the back of your ears. \n
Lift your torso up as close to your thighs as possible. \n
Lower your torso down to the floor so you’re back in the starting position \n
Do sit ups 2-3 times a week.

\n
Point your toes in the direction you want to be skipping towards. \n
Keep your head up and eyes forward. \n
Hold your abs in and chest up. \n
Keep control of the jump through your Achilles tendon and knees.

\n
Use different types of weights. \n
Incline the bench up to work the triceps long head. \n
Decline the bench to work the triceps lateral head. \n
Aim to make your upper arms perpendicular with the floor, not your body.

\n
Stand straight with feet hip-width apart \n
Tighten your stomach muscles. \n
Lower down, as if sitting \n
Straighten your legs \n
Repeat the movement

\n
Warm up for 5 minutes. \n
Keep a pace between 3 and 4 mph (4.8 and 6.4 km/h) for 20 minutes \n
Cool down for 5 minutes, by slowly lowering your pace each minute. \n
Experiment with inclines and faster speeds after the first 1 to 2 weeks
